result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward T. Linn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall pay costs within 60 days unless a payment plan is established with Clerk of Courts office

Court will grant a furlough on June 3, 2014 from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm to allow defendant to help his mother move
Concurrent with: to sentence currently serving; with work release and transfer privileges

Defendant Edward T. Linn in court, in custody with attorney William H. Gergen.  Yolanda Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 10 days mtns; stc set; parties heard on bail modification; Atty Gergen heard;  Atty Moeller also heard in regard to 13CM251; State responds; Court heard lifts stay of sentence in the CM case  and orders in the CF case bond reduced to $1000 PA bond,  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(12:52) Defendant Edward T. Linn in custody via video with attorney Stephanie R. Strickland (will appoint - Moeller).  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State requests $5000 cash bond; Def. was in court recently on 13CM251 with possible jail sentence, that case is being recalled this afternoon; State requests no contact, #6; Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim set 3/27/14 at 3:00pm in Br. 1; Court sets bond at $5,000 CASH BOND with conditions: #14, #2, #6
